lines.text: I turned 35 today. Some birthday! When's your birthday?
I don't know.
Geez, what kind of childhood did you have?
Short.

Ten years ago, I was in this bar in Alabama when two dudes started hassling me. That was their first mistake. They pulled knives. That was their second mistake. They didn't know how to use them. That was the last mistake they ever made. I got two 99-year sentences, back to back.
Seems like you could've pleaded self-defense.
The dudes were white, man. Just like you.
There's always the possibility that some asshole will be offended. Isn't there?
Something special about those steps?
The higher you sit, the more status you got. So we kind of play King of the Mountain. Except here we don't play for fun, man.
And you're King?
Yeah.
[Morris walks down the steps]
Now I figure there's two reasons why you didn't sit down on my step. Either you're too scared, or you just hate niggers. Now which is it, boy? You too scared? Hmm?

[Morris climbs back up and sits next to English]
Nah. I just hate niggers.

If you disobey the rules of society, they send you to prison; if you disobey the rules of the prison, they send you to US. Alcatraz is not like any other prison in the United States. Here, every inmate is confined ALONE... to an individual cell. Unlike my predecessors, Wardens Johnson and Blackwell, I don't have good conduct programs, I do not have inmate counsels. Inmates here have no say in what they do; they do as they're told. You're not permitted to have newspapers or magazines carrying news; knowledge of the outside world is, ah, what we tell you. From this day on, your world will be everything that happens in this building.
Tell me, you stopped killing white people?
Why?
Well, next time I wouldn't turn my back on ya.

Alcatraz was built to keep all the rotten eggs in one basket, and I was specially chosen to make sure that the stink from the basket does not escape. Since I've been warden, a few people have tried to escape. Most of them have been recaptured; those that haven't have been killed or drowned in the bay. No one has ever escaped from Alcatraz. And no one ever will!
Goodbye, boy.
So long, boy.

[sadly]
But, painting's all I have!
Is something burning?
What? I don't smell nothing.
It must be my imagination. Working nights really gets to you.
You should try it from my side.
I'm lookin' for a new punk!
Good luck.
You don't understand. I just found her!
What's your name kid?
Charley Butts.
Charley's Butt? Hahahah, you got a pretty friggin' funny name kid.
Oh yeah? What's yours?
Al Capone.
Welcome to Alcatraz.
Sometimes I think that's all this place is. One... long... count. The prisoners count the hours, the bulls count the prisoners and the king bulls count the counts.
Hey, how's it going, Frank?
Well, the Anglins. What are you guys doing, just dropping by?
Yeah, thought we'd pay you a visit.
Gonna stay long?
Nah, not long. Only about fifteen or twenty years.
Why the Rock?
We were going over the wall in Atlanta when we encountered a minor problem.
Such as?
They saw us.
Yeah, that do present problems.
So they shipped us to Leavenworth.
Yeah, but we didn't like the accommodations there, either. Warden said he knew just the place for us. Alcatraz.
Is it true no one's ever busted out of here?
So they tell me.
Jesus. I wonder what I'd be like after fifteen years here.
What'd you order this stuff for? You don't look like the painting type to me.
You wouldn't know talent if it looked you in the face.
Well I'm looking you in the face and I don't see jack shit.
Wolf wanted to get friendly. I didn't.

[examining Frank's accordion]
Been playing this thing long?
Couple of months.
You any good?
Terrible.
You'll get better. That's one of the benefits of Alcatraz - lots of time to practice.
What movie is playing this week?
Some cowboy piece of shit.
[goes into Italian-American voice]
'ey, least dey could show was a gangsta movie!
[laughs]
I may have found a way out of here.
[the group stops and stares at him]
When I get out, you're dead!
You might be dead before you get out.
Here. Put that in your report!
No forks. Hey, no forks?
You see any? You want your pasta? Hey fresh fish, do you want your pasta?
You see any?
I'm Wolf. Where did they transfer you from?
Atlanta.
Nice town, Atlanta.
I never saw it.
I may have found a way out of here.
Some men are destined never to leave Alcatraz... alive.
I'm Litmus. Like Litmus paper. When it gets cold, my face gets blue. And when it's hot, my face gets red.

[to Frank]
Warden wants to see you.
How you doing neighbor? I'm Charlie Butts.

[after Doc chopped off his fingers]
I heard about Doc, and I know why he did it. Somebody took away his painting privileges.
D-Block, Morris!
But he came at me!
I said, D-Block!
I want painting privileges taken away from Chester Dalton.
Your painting privileges have been removed.
Why?
I don't know.
Do you like the Hole Wolf? Because you are going to rot in there for a long time.

[when Butts hasn't started climbing up yet]
Goddamn it, Butts.
You looking at something?

[to Litmus' mouse]
Yeah. You're going too.
